alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Western King William; Western King and Queen (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 6:20PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern King and Queen, southeastern Caroline and northwestern King William Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 620 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Beulahville, or 11 miles northwest of Saint Stephens Church, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Saint Stephens Church, Beulahville, Mangohick, Newtown, Sparta, Owenton, Upshaw, Central Point, Epworth, Biscoe, Calno, Gether, Globe, Pollards Corner, Salvia, Duane Fork, Indian Neck and Etna Mills. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Western King William; Western King and Queen
